name: places/ChIJkYBcPvBYwokR9U9ns-lE8MA
formattedAddress: 2 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022-1002, USA

originalText.text: This is the second time I have used parkwhiz to make a parking reservation before visiting NYC for a show. They never honor reservations! They overbooked the garage and were unable to honor my reservation leaving me scrambling for NYC parking, prior to my reservation and money tied up in the app. I will never use ipark again!

They overbooked the garage and were unable to honor my reservation leaving me scrambling for NYC parking, prior to my reservation and money tied up in the app. I will never use ipark again!

originalText.text: Bunch of scam artist. Showed the guy my Groupon, he clearly saw and i stated that no spots were available.  He said no problem I will give it to you for $20. Came back and hour and a half later, saw the same exact guy and he said he never said that to us and charged us $61.00. Told him I knew exactly what he said and that's why I parked my car there. If I can give it zero stars most definitely would.

originalText.text:
Purchased a reserved parking spot for my Brother-in-law through Spothero for a 6PM Reservation. He arrived at 5:56 PM and was told that they were all filled up, and he would have to go to another garage. Unfortunately, he needs crutches to walk and he told them that he could not walk 3 or 4 blocks. They ultimately allowed him to park, but when he went to pick up car they told him that his reservation was cancelled. That was impossible since the reservation as in my name and I wasn't even present when he arrived. Ultimately, I learned from spothero that the garage cancelled his reservation. The original charge was $50 for 5 hours, but since they claimed it was cancelled that charged him $81.
Other people that attended the affair also had the same experience that my  Brother-in-law encountered. Although, they had  prepaid reservations the garage told them it was full. I had a similar experience with my own car when I left, and had to pay $31 extra to get my car out.
It is clear this is a problem were the garage accepts reservations, but prefers car that just drive up and pay a higher fee. I highly suggest you find another garage in this area.

originalText.text:
I booked a reservation at this garage through SpotHero the morning before my arrival to the garage. I entered all the necessary information including the make & model of my vehicle. I was charged an oversize fee of $15. that I was perfectly acceptable of however upon checking out the garage charged ne another oversized fee of $20. When I showed the attendant my SpotHero reservation showing the oversized vehicle fee he told me to take it up with SpotHero. Driver beware of this parking garage. I guess since this business has only 15 parking spots they must advert to overcharging their customers. Madison Ave scam business
SPOT HERO is a scam website

originalText.text:
On September 22, me and my husband parked our brand new BMW in this expensive parking garage! We returned two hours later from the Apple Store to find our car damaged by the parking attendant working that evening! We filled out an accident report on site and we were expecting to hear from someone from their Claims Department Headquarters! It has been 7 business days and no one has attempted to contact us about the damages on our brand new car! We have called the number listed on the accident report and no one answers! We have left messages and neither do they return any calls back to customers!! It’s ridiculous! Please do not park here! Save yourself the headache!

To update viewers after this review was posted my husband finally spoke to someone in the claims department. The Claims Representative requested 2 body shop estimates of what it would cost to fix our brand new BMW!! My husband informed the representative that our car had to go to a BMW Body Shop being that it’s a Lease! The representative still insisted he needed 2 estimates because we didn’t reside in Manhattan! On Oct.8 and Oct. 10 we submitted to the claims department two different estimates but prior to this my husband already explained how we had to proceed in getting the car fixed to the Claims Representative. On October 30, 2018, we received a check from the Claims Department that was a lesser amount than it would cost for BMW’s body shop to fix the car! I called the Claims Representative to rectify the mistake that was made and he informed me that they went with the Cheaper Body Shop estimate instead! We now have to pay the remaining balance that the check doesn’t cover from our own pocket!! We shouldn’t have to pay any expenses out of our pockets for the damage that was caused by the parking garage attendant! The company didn’t care how they handled this situation and neither do they care about their customers!! Please do not park here to save yourself any trouble!!
